ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor?
The primary instructor's sensitivity to students and ability to provide students with adequate feedback was:

narratives.question_text: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course:
comments: Students in this course are suppose to spend about 10 hours on work outside of individual meetings on a weekly basis. I usually spent 10-15 hours per week but there were also a few times towards the beginning of the semester that I spent less than 10 hours.
10 hours per week spent in the lab

narratives.question_text: Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved?
comments: Overall, I am very happy with the course. Working on real research data allowed me to utilize my data management skills and develop products that were helpful to the research team. Since I was able to work one-on-one with Professor Pettigrew, we established timelines that were appropriate to the both of us. In addition to meeting weekly, I also attended lab meetings to get a sense of what other team members were working on.
A wonderful learning experience, it was great to practice hands-on lab research, and it was an independent based learning format.
Good way to learn the practical side of public health research and figure out what you do and do not like about it.

For me, it was extremely useful since I was taking the course offered by the professor simultaneously as working in their lab, which allowed me to learn the material in the classroom and hands-on at the same time. I spent a lot of time with the professor's research assistants and lab assistants and barely any with her, however that is what I expected and the experience was very beneficial to me.

narratives.question_text: Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
comments: Instructor: Melinda Mary Pettigrew  Professor Pettigrew is very knowledgeable in her field of study and I was glad to be able to work with her this semester. During our weekly meetings, she would spend time teaching me about the important background information that is essential to her research project. I was able to learn a lot from these discussions on top of what I accomplished through my own data analysis.
Instructor: Melinda Mary Pettigrew  Dr. Pettigrew was available to answer any questions I had about the structure of the course, however I was primarily working with Dr. Aksoy.

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize this course for a fellow student? Would you recommend it to another student? Why or why not?
comments: This class allowed me to apply skills that I've learned in the classroom to real projects and allowed me to strengthen these skills. I would undoubtedly recommended working with Professor Pettigrew for Lab and Fields studies.
It's a wonderful course if you are looking for a true laboratory research experience.
